oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview - The Oak Ridge Boys - 2005-07-24
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview program with the Oak Ridge Boys on July 24, 2005 from the Ford Theatre at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum. In support of the exhibition The Oak Ridge Boys: Thirty Years in the Mainstream, 1975–2005
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: The Oak Ridge Boys; Neil Pond; Neil Pond; Joe Bonsall; Duane Allen; William Lee Golden; Richard Sterban;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress / (00:00) Opening comments by Neil Pond (04:10) Introduction of the Oak Ridge Boys / Interview subjects include (04:56) remembrances of first hearing the early group / (11:02) William Lee Golden talks about joining the group and meeting the other members / (13:38) Sterban talks about first seeing the early group / (15:00) Bonsall talks about first being inspired by the early group and first working with the Oaks / (18:00) Audio of video presentation from the Johnny Cash Show / (21:15) Joe talks about the attire and hair of the 1970's group and changing their style to try to be more popular in the face of resistance / (25:10) Encouragement from Johnny Cash / (26:25) Receiving phone call from Jim Halsey to tour with a package country show and getting advice from Halsey / (31:28) Memories of the significance of 1975 in their career and working with Jim Halsey and Jim Foglesong / (34:30) Touring the Soviet Union with Roy Clark /

(37:28) Working with Jimmy Dean / (38:20) Duane Allen tells story about fishing with President George H. W. Bush and other stories about the Bush family / 44:00) William Lee talks about his painting / (49:29) Richard Sterban talks about his voice and his interest in meteorology / (51:50) Talks about their interest in baseball / (55:02) Joe talks about his love of the banjo and latest musical and personal projects / (59:30) Duane Allen talks about getting help from Nashville songwriters for their projects / (01:02:25) Group performs Amazing Grace / (01:03:40) Closing comments / (01:05:04) Group performs Ya'll Come Back Saloon excerpt and Train Train excerpt / END OF TAPE.
